models.recipes: Each recipe represents a saved dish with ingredients, instructions, and details about where it came from (YouTube, website, scanned cookbook, or manually entered).

relationships: Recipes can belong to multiple Cookbooks
Recipes can be assigned to MealPlans on specific days and meal slots
Recipe ingredients can be added to ShoppingLists

recipes.title: Creamy Tuscan Chicken
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until golden and cooked through. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, sauté garlic for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add sun-dried tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in heavy cream and bring to a simmer.
Stir in parmesan cheese until melted and smooth.
Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Return chicken to the skillet and spoon sauce over the top.
Serve immediately over pasta or with crusty bread.
recipes.notes: From Eitan Bernath's channel - family favorite!

recipes.title: Classic Beef Tacos
instructions: Brown the ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat, breaking it up as it cooks.
Drain excess fat and add taco seasoning with 1/4 cup water.
Simmer for 5 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Warm tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave.
Dice tomatoes and shred lettuce for toppings.
Assemble tacos with beef, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, sour cream, and salsa.

recipes.title: Grandma's Banana Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
Mash bananas in a large bowl until smooth.
Melt butter and mix into bananas.
Beat in sugar, egg, and vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Fold dry ingredients into banana mixture until just combined.
Fold in walnuts if using.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 55-60 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack.
recipes.notes: Scanned from Mom's old recipe box. The secret is using very ripe bananas - the blacker the better!

recipes.title: Thai Green Curry
instructions: Cut chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces.
Heat a wok or large pan over high heat.
Add 1/2 cup of coconut milk and the curry paste, stir until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook until no longer pink on the outside.
Pour in remaining coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Add bamboo shoots and sliced bell pepper.
Season with fish sauce and brown sugar to taste.
Simmer for 15 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
Stir in Thai basil just before serving.
Serve over jasmine rice.
recipes.notes: Can substitute tofu for a vegetarian version

recipes.title: Simple Caprese Salad
instructions: Slice mozzarella and tomatoes into 1/4 inch thick rounds.
Arrange alternating slices of tomato and mozzarella on a plate.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the slices.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze.
Sprinkle with flaky sea salt and freshly cracked pepper.
Serve immediately at room temperature.
recipes.notes: Use the best quality ingredients you can find - this simple dish relies on them!

recipes.title: Korean Fried Chicken
instructions: Pat chicken wings completely dry with paper towels.
Mix cornstarch and rice flour in a large bowl.
Toss wings in the flour mixture until evenly coated.
Heat oil to 350°F (175°C) in a deep pot or dutch oven.
Fry wings in batches for 10 minutes until golden. Remove and drain.
Increase oil temperature to 375°F (190°C).
Fry wings again for 3-4 minutes until extra crispy.
In a small saucepan, combine gochujang, soy sauce, honey, minced garlic, and ginger.
Heat sauce until bubbling and slightly thickened.
Toss fried wings in the sauce and garnish with sesame seeds.
recipes.notes: Double frying is the secret to extra crispy wings! Make sure oil is hot enough.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl
instructions: Rinse quinoa and cook according to package directions. Let cool slightly.
Dice cucumber and halve cherry tomatoes.
Drain and rinse chickpeas.
Thinly slice red onion.
Make dressing by whisking tahini, lemon juice, 2 tbsp water, salt, and pepper.
Divide quinoa between two bowls.
Top with cucumber, tomatoes, olives, chickpeas, onion, and feta.
Drizzle with tahini dressing.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.
recipes.notes: Great for meal prep - keeps well in the fridge for 3-4 days without the dressing

recipes.title: Homemade Pizza Dough
instructions: Combine flour, yeast, and salt in a large bowl.
Mix warm water (105-110°F), olive oil, and honey.
Pour wet ingredients into dry and stir until a shaggy dough forms.
Knead for 8-10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place in an oiled bowl, cover, and let rise for 1 hour or until doubled.
Punch down dough and divide into 4 portions.
Shape each portion into a ball and let rest 15 minutes.
Stretch or roll into pizza shape.
Add toppings and bake at 500°F for 12-15 minutes.
recipes.notes: From the pizza cookbook I bought in Naples. For best results, let dough cold-ferment in fridge for 24-72 hours.
